intro: Weberbauera scabrifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved weberbauera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
